Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "We should legalize prostitution", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the context of this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Prostitutes will now have legal protection against abuse, trafficking, and diseases<sep>Keypoint: Legalizing sex work will make the profession safer for the workers
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that prostitutes will now have legal protection against abuse, trafficking, and diseases.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Prostitution is immoral and leads to a public health problem<sep>Keypoint: Legalizing sex work will increase immoral behaviour like pimping/organized crime/trafficking
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that prostitution is immoral and leads to a public health problem. Instead, it points out that it leads to illegal activities.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Prostitution is the oldest profession and will never go away. making it legal can help to make it safer.<sep>Keypoint: Legalizing sex work boosts the economy
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument about prostitution being an old profession. Instead, it refers to a boost in economy.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: There are different types of prostitution, not all is abusive and exploitative. a regulated industry based upon freedom of choice is a positive liberation and safer than the situation today<sep>Keypoint: Legalizing sex work will make the profession safer for women
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument correctly, so the answer should be True.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: There are different types of prostitution, not all is abusive and exploitative. a regulated industry based upon freedom of choice is a positive liberation and safer than the situation today<sep>Keypoint: Legalizing sex work boosts the economy
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that there are different types of prostitution, not all is abusive and exploitative.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Prostitution needs to remain illegal as it is not fair to a woman to have to sell their bodies in order to make a decent wage.<sep>Keypoint: Legalization will lead to more sexually transmitted diseases
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that it is not fair to a woman to have to sell their bodies in order to make a decent wage. So the correct answer is False.
